war_of_the_bucket_timeline.title: War of the Bucket (1325) - Complete Timeline

events.event: Passerino Bonacolsi becomes ruler of Mantua, Modena, Parma, and Reggio
Pope John XXII declares Bonacolsi enemy of Catholic Church
events.significance: Escalates political conflict to religious war

events.event: Bolognese forces enter Modenese territory and lay waste to fields
events.significance: First major provocation of the conflict

events.event: Bologna spends two weeks ravaging Modenese countryside
events.significance: Systematic destruction designed to force military response
Immediate cause of war - threatens Bologna's defenses
Later mythologized as cause of war
Largest military force in city's history

events.event: Bologna's army marches south toward Modena
Modenese scouts report approaching Bolognese force
Armies deploy for battle near Zappolino village
Battle of Zappolino begins and ends in Modenese victory
events.significance: Decisive defeat of Bologna despite numerical advantage

events.event: Bologna's survivors retreat behind city walls
Peace negotiations begin through papal intermediaries
events.significance: Both sides recognize need to end hostilities

events.event: Formal armistice signed between Bologna and Modena
events.significance: End of active warfare, Bologna accepts territorial losses

events.event: Passerino Bonacolsi murdered in Gonzaga coup
Pope Benedict XII threatens excommunication for using Guelph/Ghibelline names
events.significance: Beginning of end for medieval factions
Creates enduring bucket myth in popular culture

key_figures.name: Passerino Bonacolsi
key_figures.significance: Brilliant tactician who defeated much larger force

key_figures.name: Alessandro Tassoni
key_figures.significance: Created literary myth of bucket war

tactical_lessons: Cavalry charges effective against disorganized infantry
Terrain knowledge crucial for smaller forces
